meanings.sent1: The old car was crappier than the new one.
meanings.sent2: This phone is crappier than the one I had before.
meanings.sent3: The crappier shoes fell apart after just one day of use.
meanings.sent4: The crappier paint job made the house look like a rundown shack.
meanings.sent5: The crappier fabric felt rough and scratchy against her skin.

meanings.definition: More unpleasant or undesirable than something else.
meanings.sent1: The crappier weather ruined our plans for a picnic.
meanings.sent2: I would rather have the crappier seat if it means being closer to the stage.
meanings.sent3: His crappier jokes always make everyone groan.
meanings.sent4: The crappier news made her day even worse.
meanings.sent5: The crappier smell coming from the kitchen made her lose her appetite.
